Hazlettville is a little town seven miles west of

, Delaware's capital, in a region sometimes referred to as West Dover Amish country.

Hazlettville has a population of about 4,500 within a 5 mile radius of the center with approximately 6 established communities. It has an elevation of 59 feet and is in the Eastern Time Zone with a latitude of 39.117 and longitude of -75.642 and appears on the Marydel U.S. Geological Survey Map.
From Dover, head west on county road 73 for approximately 6 miles. From
, head west on county road 52 for approximately 6 miles.

There is no public transportation in Hazlettville. Traveling by car along the narrow country roads west of Dover, you will come across many horse drawn Amish carriages, so be sure to use caution. You may occasionally encounter a bicyclist, but take note that there are no bike lanes, so this mode of travel should be exercised with extreme caution.

The main attraction in Hazlettville besides the quaint and peaceful countryside is the large Amish community including several nice Amish Country stores and shops in the area carrying everything from homemade baked pies and quilts to handmade Amish furniture.
Byler's Country Store on county route 8 for some Amish homemade treats, quilts, furniture or even wood stoves.

There is much genuine Amish furniture to be found in the area, too.

In addition, there is an abundance of tax free shopping in Dover at the Dover Mall and various shopping centers.
There are no eateries or motel/hotels in the Hazlettville area. Your best bet is to head on back to Dover for an abundance of choices along the Route 13 corridor.

Residents of Hazlettville can be found seeking entertainment at Dover Downs for Nascar or casino games, or heading down to the Delaware Beaches along Route 1 for sun and sand, fine dining, and outlet shopping.
